=== Game Rules ===
Game rules in natural language:
Overview:
This game is an arcade-style space shooter. You control a spaceship (the “avatar”) that can fire bullets (called “sam”) in order to take out incoming enemies. The background and base give the game a cosmic, planetary feel, while the enemies (aliens) come from portals that spawn them in waves.

Game Genre:
• Arcade space shooter with classic shooting and dodging elements.
• Fast-paced, with a mix of shooting accuracy and positional maneuvering.

Core Mechanics:
• Movement & Boundaries: Your avatar moves around the level (with steps prevented from leaving the play area by “stepBack” on hitting the screen’s edge).
• Shooting: The avatar fires bullets (“sam”) that travel upward and are used to hit enemy targets.
• Enemy Behavior: Aliens spawn from invisible portals. They come in two visual types (alienBlue and alienGreen) and have attributes such as speed and bomb-dropping routines.
• Projectiles: Missiles and bombs add layers of threat. Bombs drop downward from aliens, while missiles help take enemies down. Different interactions between sprites determine which object is eliminated upon collisions.
• Interactions & Collisions: 
 – When a bullet (sam) hits an alien, both are removed, and you receive a score bonus.
 – Collisions between your avatar and aliens or bombs result in penalties.
 – The base (a planetary object) interacts with other sprites, eliminating them in collisions (for example, colliding with a bomb kills both, while colliding with sam gives a score bonus).

Objective & Win/Loss Conditions:
• Win Condition: Clear all sources of enemy spawn (the invisible “portal” sprites) and all aliens on the screen. Once there are no portals or aliens left, you win.
• Loss Condition: You lose if your single avatar is eliminated (i.e., if your spaceship is destroyed).

Overall Strategy:
1. Maintain a Safe Zone: Keep your spaceship evasive to avoid direct collisions with aliens and their bombs, as these cause penalties and can quickly lead to a loss.
2. Aim and Shoot: Use precise shooting with your upward-firing “sam” bullets to target enemies. Eliminating aliens not only clears threats but also adds positively to your score.
3. Manage Enemy Spawn: Since enemies come in waves from portals with set cooldowns and totals, focus on eliminating them as they appear before they overwhelm you.
4. Use the Base Wisely: The base seems to have interactions that might clear enemies or provide opportunities for bonus points. Though immovable, its interactions (like killing aliens on contact) may serve as additional defense if you’re careful about positioning.
5. Balance Offense and Defense: Keep attacking but be prepared to dodge bombs dropped by the bomber-type aliens. A good strategy is to stay mobile, shoot accurately, and keep an eye on enemy patterns.
6. Predict Enemy Behavior: Notice that aliens turn around when reaching screen edges and bombs travel slowly. Use these predictable patterns to plan your moves and aim accurately.

In simple words:
• Dodge enemy bombs and collisions while shooting down the alien invaders.
• Prevent the aliens from piling up by taking them out quickly before they spawn too many bombs.
• The key is to focus on eliminating all enemy sources (both the aliens and their spawning portals) without letting your spaceship get hit.

This combination of careful movement, precise shooting, and strategic planning will help you clear the space on your screen and meet the win condition.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game.
